00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Helper functions for FPA setup.
00044  *
00045  * <hr>$Revision: 75125 $<hr>
00046  */
00047 #ifndef __CVMX_HELPER_H_FPA__
00048 #define __CVMX_HELPER_H_FPA__
00049 
00050 /**
00051  * Allocate memory and initialize the FPA pools using memory
00052  * from cvmx-bootmem. Sizes of each element in the pools is
00053  * controlled by the cvmx-config.h header file. Specifying
00054  * zero for any parameter will cause that FPA pool to not be
00055  * setup. This is useful if you aren't using some of the
00056  * hardware and want to save memory.
00057  *
00058  * @param packet_buffers
00059  *               Number of packet buffers to allocate
00060  * @param work_queue_entries
00061  *               Number of work queue entries
00062  * @param pko_buffers
00063  *               PKO Command buffers. You should at minimum have two per
00064  *               each PKO queue.
00065  * @param tim_buffers
00066  *               TIM ring buffer command queues. At least two per timer bucket
00067  *               is recommended.
00068  * @param dfa_buffers
00069  *               DFA command buffer. A relatively small (32 for example)
00070  *               number should work.
00071  * @return Zero on success, non-zero if out of memory
00072  */
00073 extern int cvmx_helper_initialize_fpa(int packet_buffers,
00074                       int work_queue_entries, int pko_buffers,
00075                       int tim_buffers, int dfa_buffers);
00076 
00077 extern int __cvmx_helper_initialize_fpa_pool(int pool, uint64_t buffer_size,
00078                          uint64_t buffers,
00079                          const char *name);
00080 
00081 extern int cvmx_helper_shutdown_fpa_pools(int node);
00082 
00083 extern void cvmx_helper_fpa_dump(int node);
00084 
00085 #endif /* __CVMX_HELPER_H__ */
